content.name: Insulation coating application
content.notes: Application of electrical insulation coating to parts, wires, or components. Methods include dip coating, spray coating, or powder coating with epoxy, polyimide, ceramic, or enamel materials. Followed by curing/drying in oven. Provides electrical insulation (dielectric strength), moisture barrier, and corrosion protection. Used for magnet wires, electrical components, motor windings, and high-voltage parts. Coating thickness typically 0.05-0.5 mm.

content.name: Thermionic solar power generation (basic)

energy_model.notes: Net energy producer. Conversion efficiency: 10% primitive systems, 15-20% optimized, 30% theoretical maximum. Remaining 70-90% becomes waste heat requiring rejection.

time_model.notes: Continuous generation during lunar day (~14 Earth days). Operational during sunlight availability.

content.notes:
THERMIONIC SOLAR POWER GENERATION

Converts concentrated solar thermal energy (1600-2700°C) directly into electrical power
via thermionic emission in vacuum tube converters.

OPERATING PRINCIPLE:
- Concentrated sunlight heats tungsten cathode to emission temperature (~2000°C)
- Cathode coated with CaO to reduce work function and enable lower operating temperature
- Thermal energy causes thermionic emission - electrons "boil off" cathode surface
- Electrons flow across vacuum gap to nickel anode, generating DC electrical current
- No intermediate conversion steps (solar → thermal → electric directly)

CONVERSION EFFICIENCY:
- Primitive/v0 systems: ~10% solar-to-electric
- Optimized systems (v1/v2): 15-20%
- Theoretical maximum: 30%
- Waste heat: 70-90% must be rejected via radiators

ADVANTAGES OVER PHOTOVOLTAICS:
- 100% manufacturable from lunar materials (anorthite + NiFe meteorites)
- Higher efficiency than lunar PV (1-5% without dopants)
- Proven technology (used in space nuclear reactors: 5-20% efficiency)
- Dual-use concentrators (power + foundry operations)
- Same vacuum tube technology as computing/communications

MATERIALS (all lunar-sourced):
- Cathode: Tungsten with CaO coating (from anorthite)
- Anode: Nickel (from NiFe meteorites)
- Envelope: Fused silica glass (from anorthite)
- Concentrator: Cast glass Fresnel lenses or polished Ni mirrors

ENERGY FLOW:
Solar Irradiance → Concentrated Thermal (1600-2700°C) → Thermionic Emission
→ Electrical Power (10-30%) + Waste Heat (70-90%)

See design/solar_thermionics_report.md for complete technical specifications,
chemical processing equations, and references to source papers.

content.name: Tube bending and cutting
content.notes: Cutting and bending of metal tubing for piping, hydraulic lines, exhaust systems, and structural frames. Tube bender creates precise radius bends without crimping or flattening the tube. Cutting operations produce clean, square ends for welding or fitting connections. Typical materials: steel, stainless steel, aluminum, copper tubing. Tube sizes: 6-50 mm diameter, wall thickness 0.5-3 mm. 8% material loss due to cutting waste and setup scrap. Used in plumbing, pneumatic systems, heat exchangers, and roll cage fabrication.

content.name: Haber-Bosch nitrogen fixation process v0

energy_model.notes: High temperature and pressure operation energy

time_model.notes: Catalyst bed operation time for batch

content.notes:
Haber-Bosch process for ammonia synthesis from nitrogen and hydrogen.
Source: docs/paper_reviews/paper_reviews_dec2024_comprehensive_v0
Reaction: N2 + 3H2 ⇌ 2NH3 (exothermic, equilibrium)
Conditions: 400-500°C, 150-300 bar pressure
Catalyst: Iron with K2O, Al2O3, CaO promoters
Hydrogen source: Water electrolysis or steam reforming
Nitrogen source: Air separation (cryogenic or PSA)
Equilibrium: Favored by high pressure, low temperature
Yield: 10-20% per pass typical, unreacted gases recycled
Applications: Fertilizer production, chemical feedstock, propellant
Lunar context: Critical for agriculture, life support, chemical industry
Energy intensive: 1-2% of world energy consumption on Earth
Critical for: Long-term settlement, agricultural capability, chemical synthesis

content.notes:
Process for melting and casting nickel-iron alloys.
Source: docs/paper_reviews/paper_reviews_dec2024_comprehensive_v0
Composition: Typical Ni-Fe alloys range from 30-70% Ni
Common alloys:
  - FeNi36 (Invar): 36% Ni, low thermal expansion
  - FeNi42 (42% Ni): Controlled expansion for glass sealing
  - Permalloy (80% Ni): High magnetic permeability
Melting temperature: 1450-1550°C depending on composition
Method: Induction furnace with inert atmosphere or vacuum
Applications:
  - Low-expansion components
  - Magnetic cores
  - Glass-to-metal seals
  - Precision instruments
Lunar context: Both Ni and Fe available from meteorites and beneficiated regolith
Critical for: Precision components, magnetic materials, thermal control

content.name: Heat sink installation

energy_model.notes: Bench-top assembly energy for fixtures, fans, and small tools.

time_model.notes: Apply TIM, mount heat sink, fasten/clip, and inspect.

content.notes: Installation of heat sink for thermal management of electronic components. Process: (1) Clean component and heat sink mating surfaces, (2) Apply thermal interface material (thermal paste, thermal pad, or phase-change material), (3) Mount heat sink using spring clips, screws, or adhesive, (4) Verify good thermal contact and mechanical retention. Thermal interface fills microscopic air gaps to improve heat transfer. Used for power transistors, voltage regulators, CPUs, power supplies, and motor controllers. Reduces junction temperature and increases component reliability. Proper installation critical for thermal performance.

content.name: Material preparation (basic)

Includes cleaning (removing dirt, scale, oxidation), sizing (crushing, cutting to length), drying (moisture removal), and sorting (grading by size or quality). Methods vary by material: wire brushing for metals, washing for minerals, cutting for stock materials, drying for wet feedstocks. 5% material loss typical from cleaning waste and sizing operations. Used as preliminary step before melting, forming, machining, or chemical processing. Critical for consistent material quality in manufacturing.

content.name: Brazing process v0

energy_model.notes: Heating to brazing temperature

time_model.notes: Heat-up, soak, cool-down

content.notes:
Brazing process for joining metals with filler alloy above 450°C.
Source: Referenced by cooling_water_jacket_v0 and other recipes
Principle: Capillary action draws molten filler between close-fitting parts
Temperature: 600-1200°C typical depending on alloy
Common alloys:
  - Copper-phosphorus (self-fluxing for copper)
  - Silver-copper-zinc (general purpose)
  - Nickel-based (high temperature, corrosion resistant)
Advantages over welding: Lower temperature, joins dissimilar metals, less distortion
Applications: Heat exchangers, fittings, carbide tool tips, electronic assemblies
Atmosphere: Inert gas, vacuum, or with flux to prevent oxidation
Joint strength: Typically as strong as base metal
Critical for: Leak-tight joints, dissimilar metal joining, precision assemblies

Used to create structural components, enclosures, tanks, and machine parts.

content.name: Electrical contact material application v0

energy_model.notes: Welding or brazing energy

time_model.notes: Application and cooling time

content.notes:
Process for applying contact material (silver, tungsten, etc.) to electrical contacts.
Source: Referenced by relay_electromagnetic_v0 recipe
Methods:
  - Resistance welding (fast, good for high-volume)
  - Brazing (stronger bond, high reliability)
  - Riveting (mechanical attachment)
  - Cladding (rolling or explosive bonding)
Contact materials:
  - Silver: Low resistance, good for low-power contacts
  - Silver-cadmium oxide: Arc resistant, good for medium power
  - Tungsten: Very high temperature and arc resistance
Applications: Relays, switches, contactors, circuit breakers
Quality: Contact resistance, bond strength, arc erosion resistance
Critical for: Reliable electrical switching, long contact life

content.name: Iron smelting (reduction)
content.notes: Iron smelting via carbothermic reduction. Reduces iron oxide (Fe2O3/FeO) or ilmenite (FeTiO3) using carbon at 1200-1600°C. Produces molten iron and slag. Typical reaction: Fe2O3 + 3C → 2Fe + 3CO. On Moon, can use ilmenite from regolith or iron from meteorites. Recovery ~50% by mass.

content.name: Mixing and blending
content.notes: Mixing and blending of multiple materials to create homogeneous mixtures. Includes dry mixing of powders, wet mixing of liquids, paste mixing, and blending of composites. Methods: tumbler mixing, paddle mixing, ribbon blending, ball milling, or high-shear mixing. Used for creating alloy powders, ceramic slurries, composite materials, chemical formulations, and concrete/mortar. Mixing time and energy vary by material viscosity and desired homogeneity. Minimal material loss. Critical for material preparation in metallurgy, ceramics, composites, and chemical processing.

content.name: Microwave sintering of regolith

energy_model.notes: Microwave heating couples efficiently with nanophase iron in regolith. Reaches 1000-1500°C with rapid heating (1000°C/min). More energy-efficient than conventional sintering due to volumetric heating and strong coupling with iron particles.

time_model.notes: Very rapid process due to efficient microwave coupling. 1000°C/min heating rate possible. Typical cycle: mold filling, microwave exposure (minutes), cooling. Can be performed in-situ with mobile microwave head on rover.

content.notes:
Microwave sintering process for consolidating lunar regolith into solid construction blocks or in-situ structures.
Exploits the ubiquitous nanophase iron (np-Fe0) in lunar regolith which couples strongly with microwave radiation at 2.45 GHz.

Process characteristics:
- Operating temperature: 1000-1500°C (typically 1200°C, just below regolith melting point)
- Heating rate: Up to 1000°C/min due to excellent microwave coupling
- Compressive strength: 55 MPa achieved for microwave-sintered regolith bricks
- Stronger binding than solar sintering methods
- Can be performed in-situ using mobile microwave applicator head mounted on rover
- Typical microwave frequency: 2.45 GHz
- Power requirement: 100-350W (specification for equipment design)

Applications:
- Construction bricks and blocks
- Landing pad surfacing (in-situ sintering)
- Road/walkway paving
- Protective shells and structures
- Foundation pads for equipment

Sources:
- Ellery 2021 (Leveraging In-Situ Resources for Lunar Base Construction)
- Sustainable ISRU on the Moon
- Self-Replicating Machines on the Moon
- Paper reviews: ellery-2021-construction, Sustainable-ISRU, Self-Replicating-Machines-Moon

Provenance: ai_estimate for energy/time values based on literature descriptions
Confidence: medium (process well-documented in literature, but exact parameters estimated)

content.name: Tungsten extraction (meteorite)
content.notes: Tungsten extraction from NiFe meteorite material via magnetic separation and density separation. Meteorites contain trace tungsten (~0.5% by mass). Process: (1) Magnetic separation removes Fe/Ni, (2) Density separation concentrates tungsten (density 19.3 g/cm³) from remaining material, (3) High-temperature sintering at 3000°C+ consolidates tungsten particles. Critical for thermionic cathode production. See design/solar_thermionics_report.md for lunar tungsten sourcing.

content.name: Vacuum tube assembly
content.notes: Assembly of thermionic vacuum tube for solar power conversion. Install tungsten cathode (CaO-coated) and nickel anode inside fused silica envelope. Hermetic sealing under vacuum (10^-6 to 10^-7 torr). Critical process for thermionic converter production. Requires clean room conditions and leak-free seals. Leak testing verifies vacuum integrity. See design/solar_thermionics_report.md for specifications.

content.name: Getter material activation process v0

energy_model.notes: High-temperature activation energy

time_model.notes: Heat-up, activation, and cool-down time

content.notes:
Process for activating getter materials for vacuum systems.
Source: docs/paper_reviews/paper_reviews_dec2024_comprehensive_v0
Purpose: Getters absorb residual gases in vacuum tubes and sealed systems
Common getter materials:
  - Barium (most common): Activated by heating, absorbs O2, N2, H2O, CO2
  - Titanium: Flash getter, sublimes onto tube walls
  - Zirconium-aluminum alloys: Non-evaporable getters (NEG)
Activation process: Heat getter to 800-1200°C in high vacuum
Mechanism: Heating vaporizes or exposes fresh reactive surface
Applications:
  - Vacuum tubes (maintain vacuum over lifetime)
  - Sealed vacuum systems
  - Photomultipliers
  - X-ray tubes
Lunar context: Essential for vacuum tube electronics manufacturing
Critical for: Vacuum tube longevity, sealed system reliability

Curing time 2-24 hours depending on compound type.

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
THERMIONIC POWER SYSTEM IMPLEMENTATION ROADMAP
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

PURPOSE: This file seeds the work queue with all items needed for the
complete solar thermionic power generation system. When the indexer runs,
all items listed in requires_ids will appear as "referenced_only" gaps,
creating work queue items for workers to complete.

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CRITICAL DOCUMENTS FOR WORKERS
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

📋 TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS:
   → design/solar_thermionics_report.md

   This comprehensive report contains:
   - Technology overview and operating principles
   - Performance characteristics (10-30% conversion efficiency)
   - Complete materials list with lunar sources
   - Chemical processing equations
   - Manufacturing procedures
   - System architecture
   - References to source papers

📋 IMPLEMENTATION PLAN:
   → .claude/plans/bright-wondering-pearl.md

   This detailed plan contains:
   - All 67 files to create (broken down by phase)
   - Dependency layers for parallel work
   - Queue workflow instructions
   - File structure patterns and examples
   - Design decisions and rationale
   - Success criteria

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
SYSTEM OVERVIEW
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

Solar thermionic power generation uses concentrated sunlight to heat a
cathode in a vacuum tube, causing thermionic emission. Electrons flow from
cathode to anode, generating DC electrical power directly - no intermediate
conversion steps.

KEY ADVANTAGES OVER PHOTOVOLTAICS:
• 100% manufacturable from lunar materials (anorthite + NiFe meteorites)
• 10-30% efficiency (vs 1-5% for lunar PV without dopants)
• Dual-use concentrators (power generation + foundry operations)
• Same vacuum tube technology used for computing and communications
• Proven in space nuclear reactors (5-20% efficiency)

ENERGY FLOW:
Solar Irradiance → Concentrated Thermal (1600-2700°C) → Thermionic Emission
→ Electrical Power (10-30%) + Waste Heat (70-90%)

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
IMPLEMENTATION STATUS
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

Total items to implement: 67 files
- Materials: 6
- Parts: 13
- Machines: 3
- BOMs: 3
- Processes: 12
- Recipes: 27

WORKER INSTRUCTIONS
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

1. LEASE a work item from the queue:
   .venv/bin/python -m kbtool queue lease --agent <your-name>

2. READ the technical specifications:
   - design/solar_thermionics_report.md (for technical details)
   - .claude/plans/bright-wondering-pearl.md (for file structure patterns)

3. CREATE the file according to specifications:
   - Follow YAML patterns from existing files
   - Use lowercase_snake_case for IDs
   - Base units: kg (mass), kWh (energy), hr (time)
   - Include detailed notes with sources

4. COMPLETE the work item:
   .venv/bin/python -m kbtool queue complete --id <item-id> --agent <your-name>

5. COORDINATE via indexer:
   - After layer completion, someone runs: .venv/bin/python -m kbtool index
   - This creates next layer's work items
   - Continue until all 67 files created

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
NICKEL-IRON BATTERY SYSTEM IMPLEMENTATION ROADMAP
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

PURPOSE: This file seeds the work queue with all items needed for the
complete Ni-Fe battery manufacturing system. When the indexer runs,
all items listed in requires_ids will appear as "referenced_only" gaps,
creating work queue items for workers to complete.

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
CRITICAL DOCUMENTS FOR WORKERS
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

📋 TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS:
   → design/battery-design.md

   This comprehensive design document contains:
   - Recommended battery chemistry (Ni-Fe aqueous rechargeable)
   - Why Ni-Fe is chosen over Li-ion for lunar bootstrap
   - Complete process flow with YAML-ready data
   - Material sourcing analysis (lunar vs. import)
   - Equipment list with mass estimates
   - Provenance and confidence tags

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
SYSTEM OVERVIEW
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

Nickel-Iron (Ni-Fe) aqueous rechargeable batteries are chosen for the
lunar seed factory bootstrap phase because:

• VACUUM-COMPATIBLE MANUFACTURING: Aqueous electrolyte can be handled in
  pressurized workshop (no ultra-dry room needed like Li-ion)

• MANUFACTURING SIMPLICITY: No SEI formation complexity, no organic solvent
  handling, no micron-perfect polymer separators

• MATERIALS PLAUSIBILITY: Fe is easy (from ilmenite); Ni is partial import
  early but plannable; KOH requires K import early

• OPERATIONAL ROBUSTNESS: Tolerates abuse, long cycle life; lower Wh/kg is
  acceptable for 500 kg packs on lunar haulers

TRADE-OFF: Lower energy density (~50 Wh/kg) vs. Li-ion (~150+ Wh/kg), but
much easier to close the manufacturing dependency loop. This aligns with
project goal: growth rate > performance optimization.

ENERGY FLOW:
Iron + Nickel Compounds + KOH Electrolyte → Ni-Fe Cell → Battery Pack
→ Energy Storage for Mobile Equipment (excavators, haulers)

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
IMPLEMENTATION STATUS
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

Total items to implement: ~40 files
- Materials: 9
- Parts: 5
- Machines: 6
- BOMs: 6
- Processes: 5
- Recipes: ~10
- Resources: 6

Current status: Roadmap created, awaiting indexer run and worker deployment

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
WORKER INSTRUCTIONS
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

**BEFORE STARTING: READ design/battery-design.md COMPLETELY**

This document contains all the technical data you need:
- Process flow with quantitative estimates (mass, energy, time)
- Material sourcing decisions (what's lunar vs. import)
- Equipment specifications with masses
- Provenance and confidence tags for all numbers

1. LEASE a work item from the queue:
   .venv/bin/python -m kbtool queue lease --agent <your-name>

   Look for context.seed_files field - if it includes "battery_system_nife_v0",
   you're working on a battery-related item!

2. READ the technical specifications:
   - design/battery-design.md (REQUIRED - contains all technical data)

3. CREATE the file according to specifications:
   - Follow YAML patterns from battery-design.md document
   - Use lowercase_snake_case for IDs
   - Base units: kg (mass), kWh (energy), hr (time)
   - Include provenance tags: source + confidence level
   - All numbers in battery-design.md are "educated_guess / low-medium confidence"
     unless stated otherwise

4. KEY DESIGN DECISIONS (from battery-design.md):
   - NO glove_box_or_dry_room required (unlike Li-ion)
   - Manufacturing in pressurized_workshop is sufficient
   - Atmosphere_required: "pressurized_air" (not vacuum, not inert gas)
   - Early imports: Ni compounds, KOH, water, separators
   - Lunar-extractable: Fe (from ilmenite reduction)

5. COMPLETE the work item:
   .venv/bin/python -m kbtool queue complete --id <item-id> --agent <your-name>

6. COORDINATE via indexer:
   - After completing several items, run: .venv/bin/python -m kbtool index
   - This creates next layer's work items
   - Continue until all ~40 files created

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════
IMPORTANT NOTES
═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

• This seed file represents the Ni-Fe variant (bootstrap chemistry)
• Li-ion variant is reserved for "growth-stage" after factory is established
• All quantitative data in battery-design.md should be treated as placeholders
• Label everything with proper provenance tags
• If uncertain, mark confidence as "low" and add notes explaining assumptions

═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════

Questions? Check design/battery-design.md or ask the user for clarification.

Let's build a lunar battery system! 🌙🔋

content.name: Comprehensive Missing Technologies from 23 Paper Reviews (Dec 2024)
content.notes:
Seed file to enqueue missing technologies identified from comprehensive review
of 23 papers on lunar self-replicating systems. All items are intentional
placeholders to drive queue work.

Source: docs/paper_reviews/ directory (23 comprehensive markdown reviews)
Papers reviewed: Ellery 2021-2022, ISRU sensors/neural computing, lunar demandite,
NPV cost-benefit, rover prospecting, self-assembling structures, sustainable ISRU,
manufacturing architectures, physical self-replicating machines, and more.

Reviews completed: Dec 2024
Total missing technologies identified: ~300+

requires_ids.info:
Large Fresnel lens for solar concentration, C~10,000, achieves 2700°C focus.
Source: design/papers/ellery-2022-metalysis.txt, Section 4.2, Table 3
Review: docs/paper_reviews/ellery-2022-metalysis_missing_tech.md
Design doc: design/solar_thermionics_report.md
Priority: ESSENTIAL - enables both power generation and FFC process heat
Dependencies: glass_casting_process_v0, precision_grinding_system_v0
Notes: Concentration ratio determines max achievable temperature.
Energy efficiency: 97% thermal / 3% electrical split optimizes FFC

Parabolic mirror dish, 90% reflectivity polished Ni, 1600°C focus.
Source: design/papers/ellery-2022-metalysis.txt, Section 4.2, Figure 5
Review: docs/paper_reviews/ellery-2022-metalysis_missing_tech.md
Priority: IMPORTANT - alternative to Fresnel lens
Dependencies: nickel_sheet_rolling_v0, mirror_polishing_v0
Notes: Lower concentration but simpler manufacturing than Fresnel

Enhanced FFC Cambridge reactor with molten CaCl₂ electrolysis at 900°C.
Source: design/papers/ellery-2022-metalysis.txt, Section 3
Also: design/papers/Sustainable-ISRU-on-the-Moon.txt, Section 5.2
Review: docs/paper_reviews/ellery-2022-metalysis_missing_tech.md
Review: docs/paper_reviews/Sustainable-ISRU_missing_tech.md
Priority: ESSENTIAL - core technology for lunar metal extraction
Dependencies: molten_salt_containment_v0, graphite_anode_assembly_v0, temperature_control_system_v0
Notes: 97% thermal / 3% electrical energy split optimizes for solar thermal.
Process: CaAl₂Si₂O₈ (regolith) + heat → Ca, Al, Si metals + O₂ gas

Molten CaCl₂ electrolyte system maintained at 900°C with precise control.
Source: design/papers/ellery-2022-metalysis.txt, Section 3.1
Review: docs/paper_reviews/ellery-2022-metalysis_missing_tech.md
Dependencies: ffc_reactor_enhanced_v0, temperature_control_system_v0
Notes: Temperature stability critical for process efficiency

Electron Beam Melting machine for metal additive manufacturing.
Source: design/papers/Self-Replicating-Machines-on-the-Moon.txt, Section 4.3, Table 2
Review: docs/paper_reviews/Self-Replicating-Machines-Moon_missing_tech.md
Priority: ESSENTIAL - preferred AM technology for lunar application
Energy efficiency: 10-20% (vs laser 2-5%)
Dependencies: electron_gun_assembly_v0, ebm_vacuum_chamber_v0, ebm_powder_handling_system_v0
Notes: Higher efficiency comes from direct electron heating vs optical absorption.
Operating envelope: Vacuum, heated build platform 600-1000°C

content.notes: Manufacturing of assembled wire harness. Total fabrication time ~8.5 hours. Pre-assembled harnesses reduce equipment assembly time and improve reliability. Critical for complex equipment with multiple electrical connections.

content.assumptions: Heavy-duty crushing jaw set for jaw crusher primary rock and ore reduction. 150 kg total for fixed and movable jaw plates. High-manganese steel (12-14% Mn) or high-chromium cast iron construction for extreme wear resistance. Crushing faces may have corrugated or ribbed profiles to improve grip on rock. Used in mining, quarrying, and mineral processing for reducing rocks from 500-1000 mm down to 50-150 mm fragments. Critical wear components requiring periodic replacement.
content.notes: Manufacturing of crushing jaw set. Total fabrication time ~42 hours. Extensive casting of large wear-resistant steel components, precision machining for mounting and alignment, heat treatment for hardness, and surface profiling. High wear resistance essential - jaws subject to extreme abrasive forces from crushing hard rock. Materials selected for toughness and abrasion resistance.

steps.notes: Cast machine base, column, and table from cast iron for vibration damping and rigidity (total ~600-800 kg castings)
Precision machine all mating surfaces, linear guide ways, spindle housing bore, and mounting surfaces; scrape ways to precision tolerances (±0.005 mm)

Wire CNC controller to servo drives and motors, install limit switches and home sensors, integrate spindle control and tool changer, connect operator panel
Align axes for perpendicularity and parallelism (within ±0.01 mm), level machine base, adjust backlash in ball screws
Program test toolpaths, verify axis motion and positioning accuracy, test spindle operation and tool changing, run test parts
Calibrate axes using laser interferometer or precision gauge blocks, tune servo parameters for optimal performance
Verify positioning accuracy (±0.01-0.02 mm), repeatability, surface finish capability, and safety interlocks

content.assumptions: CNC milling machine for automated precision machining. 1200 kg system with cast iron base/column/table for rigidity. 3-axis (X/Y/Z) motion control with ball screws and linear guides. Spindle speeds 100-10,000+ RPM, power 3-7.5 kW. Travel typically 500x400x400 mm. Includes CNC controller (3+ axis), servo motors with encoders, automatic tool changer (optional), coolant system, and chip guard. Positioning accuracy ±0.01-0.02 mm.
content.notes: Assembly of CNC milling machine. Total fabrication time ~155 hours. Extensive precision machining of base components, complex mechanical and electrical integration, and rigorous alignment/calibration required. Critical machine tool for precision manufacturing and prototyping. Much more complex than manual milling machine due to CNC control system and automated features.

steps.notes: Cast lathe bed from cast iron (~400-450 kg) with integral ways and headstock mounting area; allow extended cooling and stress relieving (days to weeks)
Weld steel reinforcements to bed if fabricated design; fabricate and weld headstock housing from steel plate
Precision machine bed ways (V-ways and flat ways) to extremely tight tolerances (±0.01 mm), machine headstock bore for spindle bearings, drill/tap mounting holes
Scrape ways by hand to achieve final precision and straightness (±0.005 mm over full length), verify parallelism of ways
Grind and polish critical surfaces, apply protective coating (paint or oil) to prevent rust
Verify straightness, flatness, and parallelism of ways using precision straight edge and autocollimator; check headstock bore concentricity

content.assumptions: Precision lathe bed and headstock assembly. 500 kg cast iron bed with precision-ground ways and integrated or mounted headstock housing. Bed length typically 1-2 meters with V-ways and flat ways for carriage and tailstock travel. Headstock houses spindle bearings and drive system. Requires extreme precision - way straightness and flatness within ±0.005-0.01 mm over full length, parallelism between ways within ±0.01 mm. Critical component determining lathe accuracy. Cast iron chosen for vibration damping and dimensional stability.
content.notes: Manufacturing of lathe bed and headstock. Total fabrication time ~120 hours. Extremely demanding precision machining and hand scraping required for machine tool accuracy. Casting must be stress-relieved for dimensional stability. Final precision achieved by hand scraping ways - traditional machine tool building technique. Most time-consuming and skill-intensive component of lathe construction. Accuracy of this component determines turning precision of entire lathe.

content.assumptions: Critical thermionic converter component. Tungsten powder from NiFe meteorites, sintered at 3000°C. CaO coating from anorthite extraction reduces work function from 4.5eV to ~2.0eV, dramatically improving thermionic emission. 100% lunar-manufacturable. See: design/solar_thermionics_report.md
content.notes: Production of CaO-coated tungsten cathode for thermionic power conversion. The CaO coating is critical for efficient electron emission at ~2000°C operating temperature. Total fabrication time ~13 hours. Key component enabling 10-30% solar-to-electric conversion efficiency.

steps.notes: Cast heavy-duty pump body and end caps from high-strength cast iron or steel (combined ~60-70 kg)
Precision machine pump body bore, end cap mating surfaces, gear/piston pockets, port threads, and seal grooves to tight tolerances (±0.01 mm) for minimal leakage
Machine internal pump gears (or pistons), drive shaft, bearings seats, and mounting flange with precision tooth/piston profiles
Harden and temper gears, drive shaft, and high-wear surfaces for durability and wear resistance
Assemble internal gears/pistons in pump body, install bearings and seals, attach end caps with high-strength fasteners, install drive shaft
Pressure test pump at rated pressure (200+ bar), verify flow rate and pressure output, check seal integrity under load
Verify pump displacement, pressure rating, volumetric efficiency, and absence of leaks or noise

content.assumptions: Heavy-duty hydraulic pump for high-pressure, high-flow industrial applications. 80 kg gear or piston pump rated for 200-350 bar operating pressure. Displacement typically 40-100 cc/rev. Used in excavators, large presses, injection molding machines, and heavy mobile equipment. Includes precision-machined pump body, hardened gears/pistons, drive shaft with bearings, high-pressure seals, and mounting flange. Flow rate typically 40-120 L/min.
content.notes: Manufacturing of heavy-duty hydraulic pump. Total fabrication time ~64 hours. Requires extensive precision machining for tight internal clearances (critical for high pressure), heat treatment for wear resistance, and rigorous leak testing. More demanding than standard hydraulic pumps due to higher pressures and flows. Critical component for heavy industrial machinery.

Heavier duty than wire harnesses. Used in industrial equipment, machinery power distribution, and control systems.
content.notes: Manufacturing of assembled cable harness. Total fabrication time ~12.5 hours. More robust than wire harness due to larger conductors and higher current capacity. Critical for equipment power distribution.

content.assumptions: Adjustable work rest for supporting workpieces during grinding, turning, or machining operations. 10 kg steel construction with precision-machined base, adjustable support arm, height and position adjustment mechanisms, and locking screws. content.notes: Manufacturing of adjustable work rest. Total fabrication time ~12.5 hours. Requires precision machining for smooth adjustment and stable support. Critical accessory for grinding and turning long or flexible workpieces that need intermediate support to prevent deflection.

content.name: Regolith coarse fraction
content.notes: Oversize fraction after initial screening/sieving.

content.name: Sintered parts
content.notes: Parts produced by sintering process from powder metal or ceramic. Consolidated solid structure formed by diffusion bonding below melting point. Can be metal or ceramic depending on input powder.

content.name: Iron ore or ilmenite
content.notes: Iron-bearing ore for metal extraction. On the Moon, primary source is ilmenite (FeTiO3) found in lunar mare basalts, typically 10-20% by mass in regolith. Also available from NiFe meteorites. On Earth includes magnetite (Fe3O4), hematite (Fe2O3), and other iron oxides. Ilmenite processed by carbothermal reduction or hydrogen reduction to yield metallic iron and titanium oxide. Lunar ilmenite abundance makes it key feedstock for in-situ iron production. Raw ore requires crushing, concentration, and reduction/smelting to extract pure iron metal.

content.name: Solar irradiance
content.notes: Incident solar energy captured by PV.

content.name: Tube assembled evacuated
content.notes: Intermediate product after assembly and evacuation, before getter activation.

content.name: Hydrochloric acid
content.notes: Acid used to synthesize NaCl with sodium hydroxide.

content.name: Alumina powder
content.notes: Al2O3 powder used as input for ceramic substrate sintering; placeholder mass.

content.name: Ammonia gas
content.notes: Ammonia gas (NH3) produced in Haber-Bosch process; placeholder material for balance and imports accounting.

content.name: Deposited metal structure

content.name: Solar radiation
content.notes: Solar radiation energy from the sun. Freely available environmental resource used for solar thermal concentration and photovoltaic power generation. Approximately 1361 W/m² at lunar surface (no atmosphere).

content.name: Cooling radiator (anode)
content.notes: Thermal radiator for anode cooling.

content.name: Etching chemicals
content.notes: Chemicals for PCB etching and metal surface etching. Common etchants include ferric chloride (FeCl3), ammonium persulfate, or cupric chloride for copper removal. Also includes photoresist developers and stripping solutions. Used in PCB fabrication and chemical milling.

content.name: Bent tube sections
content.notes: Bent sections of tubing used as feedstock for tube bending operations; placeholder mass until BOM/details are finalized.

content.name: Assembly loss

content.name: Binder material
content.notes: Organic or inorganic binder for powder metallurgy and ceramic forming. Provides green strength to powder compacts before sintering. May include wax, polymer, or ceramic binders depending on application. Typically burns out during sintering process.

content.name: Regolith powder (HCl-treated)
content.notes: HCl-treated regolith powder, placeholder intermediate for leaching steps; mass preserved from input; properties TBD.

content.name: Iron pig or ingot
content.notes: Cast iron metal in pig/ingot form for storage and downstream processing.

content.name: Machined steel part (precision)
content.notes: Generic precision-machined steel part with tight tolerances and good surface finish. Produced by turning, milling, drilling, grinding, or multi-axis machining. Dimensional tolerances ±0.01-0.05 mm, surface finish Ra 0.8-3.2 μm. Used as shafts, bushings, gears, housings, brackets, and structural components. May require heat treatment for hardness. Ready for assembly into machines or further finishing operations (plating, coating, heat treatment). Higher quality and cost than rough machined parts due to precision machining requirements.

content.name: Manchester encoding
content.notes:
Seed placeholder for Manchester encoding data transformation. Represents a data-encoding
step referenced in seed reviews but not yet modeled as a full process/recipe in the KB.

content.name: Nickel-Aluminum alloy
content.notes: Alumel, Ni-Al alloy used for Type K thermocouples; provides proper thermoelectric pairing.

content.name: Titanium oxide

content.name: Magnesium silicide
content.notes: Solid compound Mg2Si; feedstock for silicon purification via MgSi reduction. Treated as import unless a local production process is defined.

content.name: Assembled electronics
content.notes: General assembled electronic modules and circuit boards. Includes populated PCBs, control modules, sensor assemblies, and power electronics. Components soldered to circuit boards with wiring and connectors installed. Ready for integration into larger systems or equipment.

content.name: Transformer laminated steel (core laminations)
content.notes: Laminated steel used for transformer cores (thin iron sheets with insulating layers). Seed item mentioned in seed paper (paper_reviews_dec2024_comprehensive_v0). Treated as an import until a production recipe exists; mass and processing details are unknown.

content.name: NiFe alloy byproduct
content.notes: Nickel-iron alloy byproduct from meteorite processing. Produced when extracting tungsten, nickel, or other trace elements from NiFe meteorite material. Typical composition 5-20% Ni, balance Fe with minor elements. Can be used as structural material, alloying element, or feedstock for further metal refining. Magnetic properties make it useful for electromagnets and magnetic shielding. Lower purity than refined nickel or iron but still valuable for non-critical structural applications. Lunar resource utilization byproduct.

content.name: Pyroxene concentrate
content.notes: Concentrated pyroxene produced by separation from regolith.

content.name: Concentrated mineral

content.name: Fused silica
content.notes: Fused silica (quartz glass) produced by melting purified silica at ~1700°C. Amorphous glass with excellent optical and thermal properties. Used for high-performance applications including optical components and vacuum tube envelopes.

content.name: Dust mitigation coating

content.name: Steel stock (bar or billet)
content.notes: Semi-finished steel product in bar or billet form. Used as feedstock for forging, machining, and other metalworking operations. Produced from steel ingots through hot rolling or continuous casting.

content.name: Iron powder or sheet

content.name: Silicon nitride ceramic (Si3N4) v0
content.notes:
Silicon nitride (Si3N4) advanced ceramic material.
Source: docs/paper_reviews/paper_reviews_dec2024_comprehensive_v0
Properties:
  - Very high hardness (1600-2000 Hv)
  - Excellent thermal shock resistance
  - Low thermal expansion
  - Good wear resistance
  - High strength at elevated temperatures
  - Density: 3.2-3.3 g/cm³
Processing: Reaction bonded (RBSN), hot pressed (HPSN), or sintered (SSN)
Applications:
  - Cutting tools and inserts
  - Wear parts and bearings
  - High-temperature components
  - Crucibles for metal melting
Lunar context: Si available from lunar regolith, N2 from atmosphere processing
Temperature capability: Up to 1400°C in inert atmosphere
Advantages: Superior to alumina for high-stress, thermal-shock applications
Critical for: Advanced tooling, high-temperature processes, precision bearings

content.name: Insulation coating material
content.notes: Electrical insulation coating material for wire, components, and assemblies. Types include: epoxy resin, polyimide (Kapton), polyurethane, acrylic, enamel, or ceramic slurry. Applied by dipping, spraying, or powder coating followed by curing. Provides dielectric strength (2-20 kV/mm), moisture barrier, chemical resistance, and temperature resistance (150-400°C depending on type). Used for magnet wire insulation, transformer coatings, motor windings, and high-voltage component protection. Typical coating thickness 0.05-0.5 mm.

content.name: Coarse powder

Materials include metal powders (iron, aluminum, copper), ceramic powders (alumina, silica), mineral powders (limestone, ore concentrates), or organic powders. Produced by jaw crushing, hammer milling, or coarse grinding. Used as feedstock for ball milling, fine grinding, or direct sintering/pressing for less critical applications. Easier to produce than fine powders but may have lower packing density and sintering performance.

content.name: Magnet wire (copper)
content.notes: Insulated copper wire for electrical windings. Thin enamel or polymer insulation coating allows tight coil packing. Used for electric motor windings, transformer coils, inductors, electromagnets, and solenoids. Various gauges (AWG) for different current and voltage applications.

content.name: Tailings silicate mix

content.name: Electrolyte
content.notes: Electrolyte material for batteries and electrochemical processes. Types include: liquid electrolytes (sulfuric acid for lead-acid, lithium salt solutions for Li-ion), gel electrolytes (polymer-based), solid electrolytes (ceramic), or molten salts (high-temperature batteries). Enables ion transport between electrodes while preventing electron flow. Key properties: ionic conductivity, electrochemical stability window, temperature range. Used in batteries, electrolysis cells, electroplating, and fuel cells. Composition varies widely by application - examples: H2SO4 (lead-acid), LiPF6 in organic solvents (Li-ion), KOH (alkaline), molten sodium (Na-S batteries).

content.name: Coolant piping

content.name: Tailings
content.notes: Waste material from mining and mineral processing operations. Consists of crushed rock, ore gangue (non-valuable minerals), and residual process chemicals after valuable minerals have been extracted. Composition varies by source ore: silicate rock from metal extraction, limestone from iron smelting, etc. Generally low-value material but may contain trace recoverable elements. Can be reprocessed for additional extraction, used as construction aggregate, or stored in tailings ponds. On the Moon, may be reprocessed for trace elements or used as regolith cover/radiation shielding. Byproduct of mining and metallurgical processes.

Nickel ferrite (NiFe2O4) used as a soft ferrite magnetic material for transformer cores.

content.name: Uncoated substrate

content.name: Simple binder material
content.notes:
Simple organic binder for battery electrode manufacturing.
Source: kb/seeds/battery_system_nife_v0.yaml (NiFe battery production)
Chemistry: Water-soluble polymer or starch-based binder
Purpose: Hold active materials together in battery electrodes
Typical binders: PVDF, CMC (carboxymethyl cellulose), starch, PVA (polyvinyl alcohol)
Application: Mixed with active materials (Ni(OH)2, Fe powder) and conductive additives
Properties: Good adhesion, electrochemically stable, processable in water or solvent
Lunar context: Simple starch or cellulose derivatives preferred for manufacturability
Usage: 5-15% by mass in electrode slurry
Critical for: Battery electrode cohesion and mechanical integrity

content.name: Non-magnetic tailings
content.notes: Tailings after magnetic beneficiation.

content.name: Mineral ore sulfide
content.notes: Lunar sulfide ore used as feedstock for selenium extraction (selenium_extraction_refining_v0).

content.name: Magnetic tape reel
content.notes: Consumable magnetic tape reel used in archival data storage systems. Mass is modeled as 0.05 kg per reel for initial approximations; other properties are unspecified.

content.name: CMC solution
content.notes: Solution containing carboxymethyl cellulose prepared from cellulose; feed for precipitation.

content.name: Green ceramic part
content.notes: Unfired ('green') ceramic part after forming but before sintering. Formed from ceramic powder mixture with binders. Fragile and requires careful handling. Ready for drying and sintering to achieve final strength and density.

content.name: MnZn ferrite
content.notes:
MnZn ferrite ceramic used for high-frequency transformer cores. Seed entry for
magnetic core material in Ellery-based analyses; placeholder mass to drive
queue-based modeling. Local manufacturing of ferrite powders and cores not yet modeled.

content.name: Concentrated solar thermal energy
content.notes: High-temperature thermal energy concentrated from solar radiation. Intermediate energy form for thermionic conversion or industrial heating. Output from solar concentrators.

content.name: Concentrated thermal energy
content.notes: High-temperature thermal energy concentrated from heat sources. Intermediate energy form for industrial heating, power generation, or materials processing.

content.name: Sintering furnace v0

content.name: Cement mixer (small)
content.notes: Small cement mixer for binder preparation; coarse mass estimate.

content.name: Lattice Builder Gantry
content.notes: Heavy robotic gantry for constructing lattice/ truss structures on lunar ISRU platforms. Placeholder spec; mass and capabilities are provisional estimates.

content.name: Enhanced FFC Cambridge reactor
content.notes: Enhanced fluoride-fluoride conversion (FFC) reactor for molten CaCl2 electrolysis at ~900°C. Primary outputs: Ca, Al, Si metals and O2 gas from regolith-derived feedstock. Energy split typically ~97% thermal and ~3% electrical; integration with solar thermal. Dependencies at installation: molten_salt_containment_v0, graphite_anode_assembly_v0, temperature_control_system_v0. Seed context: from Ellery/Moon ISRU literature; see seeds/paper reviews for provenance.

content.name: Arc welding welder
content.notes: Arc welding welder for joining metal components. Seed machine referenced in seed document; conservative mass and capability defaults added for modeling.

content.name: Solar array cleaning brush
content.notes: Portable brush system for removing dust from solar arrays; includes motorized brush and frame/handle. Placeholder mass and components.

content.name: Rock crusher (basic)
content.notes: Basic rock crusher for primary size reduction of regolith, ore, and rock. Jaw or cone crusher design reduces large rocks to smaller aggregate sizes for further processing. Essential for mineral extraction and regolith processing operations.

content.name: Heat pipe solar receiver v0
content.notes: Seed machine representing a heat pipe solar receiver (advanced concept). Placeholder mass and capabilities; a basic manufacturing recipe exists to build this item from standard unit operations (recipe_heat_pipe_solar_receiver_v0.yaml). This entry remains as seed for further refinement; gaps highlighted by the indexer guide next modeling steps.

content.name: Roll grinding lathe or cylindrical grinder
content.notes: Placeholder grinding machine for roll processing

content.name: Milling machine (general) v0
content.notes: DEPRECATED - Consolidated into milling_machine_cnc. General-purpose milling machine; coarse mass estimate.

content.name: PCB fabrication equipment
content.notes: Equipment for printed circuit board (PCB) fabrication. Includes photolithography exposure unit (UV light source), chemical etching tanks (ferric chloride or ammonium persulfate), development trays, drilling station (CNC or manual), and tinning/plating bath. Produces single and double-sided PCBs from copper-clad laminate. Subtractive process: UV exposure of photoresist, development, etching, drilling, and surface finishing. Typical board size up to 300x400 mm. Resolution 0.2-0.5 mm traces.

content.name: Hydraulic press (small)
content.notes: DEPRECATED - Consolidated into hydraulic_press. Small hydraulic press for forming, stamping, and powder compaction. Includes press frame, hydraulic cylinder, pump, and controls. Lower tonnage than main production presses.

content.name: Power hammer or press v0
content.notes: DEPRECATED - Consolidated into hydraulic_press. Small power hammer/press for forming tasks; coarse mass estimate.

content.name: Power hammer or press
content.notes: Power hammer or mechanical press for hot forging and metal forming operations. Provides repeated impact or sustained pressure to shape heated metal. Essential for producing forged components with enhanced grain structure and mechanical properties.

content.name: Cell sealer station
content.notes: Sealing station for battery cells (crimp or weld lids, add terminals). Mass and role from battery-design.md seed list; includes fixtures and controls for leak-tight closure.

content.name: Inert atmosphere system
content.notes: Inert atmosphere control system for high-temperature processing. Provides argon or nitrogen atmosphere to prevent oxidation during sintering, heat treatment, and welding. Includes gas storage, flow controls, oxygen sensors, and purge system. Critical for tungsten sintering at 2700-3000°C in thermionic cathode production.

content.name: Plate rolling mill
content.notes: Plate rolling mill for producing metal plate from ingots or billets. Heavy rollers compress heated metal through multiple passes to achieve desired thickness. Used for producing steel plate, sheet metal stock, and structural materials. Includes drive motors, roll adjustment, and heating system.

content.name: Hydraulic power unit (basic)
content.notes: Basic hydraulic power unit providing pressurized hydraulic fluid. Includes hydraulic pump, reservoir, motor, filtration, pressure relief valve, and controls. Supplies hydraulic power to actuators, presses, and mobile equipment. Various pressure and flow ratings.

content.name: Power supply (bench)
content.notes: Bench power supply for testing, electronics work, and low-power applications. Provides adjustable DC voltage and current limiting. Used in electronics assembly, testing, and small-scale manufacturing operations.

content.name: Optical microscope v0
content.notes:
Optical microscope for inspection and quality control.
Source: docs/paper_reviews/paper_reviews_dec2024_comprehensive_v0
Magnification: 40x-1000x typical
Resolution: ~0.2 micron (diffraction limited)
Illumination: Transmitted or reflected light
Objective lenses: Multiple magnifications (4x, 10x, 40x, 100x)
Eyepiece: 10x typical
Stage: Mechanical stage for specimen positioning
Focusing: Coarse and fine focus adjustments
Applications:
  - Metallography (grain structure, defects)
  - Quality control (dimensions, surface finish)
  - Biological samples (if applicable)
  - Electronics inspection (PCB traces, wire bonds)
Lunar context: Essential for quality control, failure analysis, research
Critical for: Manufacturing quality, materials characterization, troubleshooting

content.name: Dynamic balancing machine

content.name: Controlled cooling chamber

content.notes: Magnetic separation equipment for mineral processing. Uses permanent magnets or electromagnets to separate magnetic minerals (iron, magnetite, ilmenite) from non-magnetic gangue. Belt, drum, or cross-belt configurations. Essential for iron ore beneficiation and recovery of magnetic minerals from regolith.

content.name: Cold trap module

Lunar Auger Drill and ISRU (LADI) system for water extraction from regolith.

Method: Drill into regolith, heat to release adsorbed water, capture vapor
Components: Auger drill, heating system, vapor collection
Typical depth: 0.5-2 meters to access volatile-rich regolith
Operating temperature: 100-300°C to desorb water
Applications: Water extraction from permanently shadowed craters

content.name: Build atmosphere control system v0

Used for surface finishing, corrosion protection, electrical insulation, and thermal barrier coatings. Typical throughput 10-50 kg/hr depending on coating type and part size.

content.name: Coil winding machine

content.name: Thermionic converter v0
content.notes: Vacuum tube-based thermionic power converter array. Converts concentrated solar thermal energy (1600-2700°C) directly into electrical power via thermionic emission. Uses CaO-coated tungsten cathodes heated to ~2000°C, nickel anodes for electron collection, and fused silica vacuum tube envelopes. Conversion efficiency: 10% primitive systems, 15-20% optimized, 30% theoretical maximum. 100% lunar-manufacturable from anorthite and meteoritic materials. See: design/solar_thermionics_report.md

content.name: Specialist labor bot v0

content.name: Cylindrical grinding machine v0
content.notes:
Cylindrical grinding machine for precision finishing of round parts.
Source: docs/paper_reviews/paper_reviews_dec2024_comprehensive_v0
Process: Abrasive wheel rotates and traverses along rotating workpiece
Typical tolerances: ±1-5 microns diameter, 0.1-0.4 micron surface finish
Wheel types: Aluminum oxide, silicon carbide, diamond, CBN
Applications: Bearing races, shafts, pins, precision cylinders
Components: Spindle, wheelhead, tailstock, traverse mechanism, dressing tool
Wheel speed: 1500-2000 m/min typical
Work speed: 10-30 m/min typical
Coolant: Required for temperature control and chip removal
Lunar context: Essential for precision bearing and shaft manufacturing
Critical for: High-precision components, tight tolerance work

content.name: Assembly station

Includes sturdy workbench with tool storage, adjustable lighting, compressed air supply, power outlets, and ESD protection (if needed for electronics). Equipped with hand tools, fixtures, fasteners, and small parts storage. Used for machine assembly, product assembly, sub-assembly integration, and repair work. Supports manual assembly operations with ergonomic work surface and organized tool access.

content.name: Parabolic dish antenna v0
content.notes:
Parabolic dish antenna for high-gain directional communications.
Source: docs/paper_reviews/paper_reviews_dec2024_comprehensive_v0
Design: Parabolic reflector focuses signals at feed point
Diameter: 1-5m typical for lunar applications
Gain: 30-50 dBi depending on size and frequency
Beamwidth: Narrow (1-10 degrees) for directional links
Frequency bands: S-band (2-4 GHz), X-band (8-12 GHz), Ka-band (26-40 GHz)
Feed types: Horn antenna, dipole with reflector, or helical
Pointing: Manual or motorized mount for tracking
Applications:
  - Earth communications (high data rate downlink)
  - Satellite relay links
  - Long-range rover communications
Surface accuracy: λ/16 RMS for high efficiency (sub-mm for X-band)
Construction: Spun or stamped aluminum, composite, or mesh
Lunar context: Essential for high-bandwidth Earth communications
Critical for: Data transmission, remote operation, scientific data downlink

content.name: Magnetic core memory threading machine v0
content.notes:
Automated or semi-automated machine for threading magnetic core memory.
Source: docs/paper_reviews/papers_gap_seed_v0 (computing hardware)
Technology: Magnetic core memory - ferrite toroids threaded with wires
Process: X, Y, Z sense/inhibit wires threaded through matrix of cores
Grid: Cores arranged in N×N grid, each core = 1 bit storage
Threading: Precise wire routing through each core (X, Y, sense, inhibit wires)
Challenges: Extremely tedious manual process, automation highly desirable
Typical production: 4096-bit core plane (64×64 cores) takes hours manually
Automation: XY positioning table with wire threading needle mechanism
Quality: Visual inspection, continuity testing, read/write verification
Applications: Non-volatile memory for computing systems (1950s-1970s tech)
Lunar context: Proven technology, radiation-hard, manufacturable with local materials
Critical for: Computer memory in vacuum tube computing systems

content.name: Hydraulic regolith brick press v0
content.notes:
Hydraulic press for compacting lunar regolith into construction bricks.
Source: docs/paper_reviews/paper_reviews_dec2024_comprehensive_v0
Process: High pressure compaction of regolith, optionally with binder
Pressure: 10-100 MPa typical for adequate brick strength
Brick size: Variable molds (e.g., 200×100×50mm standard brick)
Cycle time: 1-5 minutes per brick depending on pressure and curing
Sintering: May be followed by solar or furnace sintering for higher strength
Applications:
  - Radiation shielding walls
  - Habitat construction
  - Landing pad construction
  - Road construction
Advantages: Uses abundant local regolith, simple process, low energy
Brick properties: Compressive strength 5-50 MPa depending on processing
Lunar context: Essential for in-situ construction and infrastructure
Critical for: Shelter, radiation protection, infrastructure development

content.name: Sabatier reactor for CO2 reduction v0

Purpose: Carbon recovery and methane production
Followed by methane pyrolysis: CH4 → C + 2H2 (carbon black recovery)
Net: CO2 + 4H2 → C + 2H2O (carbon recovery with H2 recycling)
Operating conditions: 300-400°C, Ni or Ru catalyst, moderate pressure
Critical for: Carbon feedstock recovery in closed-loop chemical systems
Enables recovery of imported carbon from CO2 waste streams

Must be capable of: Process control, scheduling, quality monitoring, self-description processing

Handles two-part epoxy, polyurethane, and silicone potting compounds. Used for environmental protection of sensors, power supplies, motor controllers, and harsh-environment electronics. Typical throughput 10-50 assemblies per day depending on size and cure time.

content.name: Self-description tape storage system v0
content.notes:
Physical storage system for von Neumann self-description.
Source: docs/paper_reviews/photolithoautotroph_missing_tech.md, von Neumann architecture
Purpose: Store complete blueprints and instructions for self-replication
Implementation options:
  - Magnetic tape storage (proven technology)
  - Punched tape (mechanical readability)
  - Magnetic drum storage
  - Core memory banks
Von Neumann requirement: Universal constructor must read self-description to replicate
Must store: All item specs, process definitions, machine designs, control programs
Capacity: ~10-100 MB estimated for complete factory description
Redundancy: Multiple copies for reliability
Read/write: Magnetic or mechanical read/write heads
Critical for: Self-replication capability, bootstrap from minimal seed

content.name: PETE (Photon Enhanced Thermionic Emission) converter v0
content.notes:
PETE (Photon Enhanced Thermionic Emission) solar energy converter.
Source: docs/paper_reviews/paper_reviews_dec2024_comprehensive_v0, thermionic power generation
Principle: Photons heat cathode and excite electrons, which emit thermionically
Combines photovoltaic excitation with thermionic emission
Cathode: Low work function material (cesium-coated, diamond, or specialized semiconductors)
Anode: Collector electrode at lower temperature
Vacuum gap: Electrons traverse vacuum space
Theoretical efficiency: 40-50% (combines photo-excitation with thermal emission)
Operating temperature: 600-1000°C at cathode
Advantages: Higher efficiency than pure thermionic, simpler than hybrid PV-thermal
Challenges: Maintaining low work function, space charge effects, thermal management
Lunar context: Concentrated sunlight provides both photons and heat
Development status: Experimental, demonstrated in labs
Critical for: High-efficiency solar power, future power generation systems

content.name: Stepper motor v0
content.notes:
Stepper motor for precise positioning without feedback.
Source: Referenced by various positioning systems (XY tables, threading machines, etc.)
Principle: Electromagnetic coils energized in sequence rotate rotor in discrete steps
Step angle: 0.9°, 1.8°, or 3.6° typical (400, 200, or 100 steps/rev)
Types: Permanent magnet, variable reluctance, hybrid
Torque: Holding torque higher than running torque
Control: Requires stepper driver with step/direction signals
Advantages: Open-loop positioning, no encoder needed, holds position at rest
Disadvantages: Can lose steps under overload, resonance at certain speeds
Applications: 3D printers, CNC machines, robotics, precision stages
Microstepping: Driver technique for smoother motion and higher resolution
Typical size: NEMA 17 (42mm) or NEMA 23 (57mm)
Lunar context: Reliable positioning without complex feedback systems
Critical for: Precision motion control, automated machinery

content.name: Resource holon agent v0
content.notes:
Resource holon - autonomous agent for manufacturing resource management.
Source: docs/paper_reviews/paper_reviews_dec2024_comprehensive_v0, holonic manufacturing systems
Concept: Self-organizing manufacturing control paradigm
Holon types:
  - Resource holons: Manage physical manufacturing resources (machines, tools, materials)
  - Product holons: Represent product requirements and processes
  - Order holons: Manage production tasks and schedules
Resource holon functions:
  - Monitor resource state (available, busy, maintenance)
  - Accept and reject production tasks based on capability
  - Negotiate with other holons for scheduling
  - Report status and performance
Advantages: Decentralized control, flexible scheduling, fault tolerance
Implementation: Agent-based software running on local controller
Communication: Peer-to-peer messaging between holons
Applications: Flexible manufacturing, self-organizing factories, autonomous production
Lunar context: Essential for autonomous self-replicating factory operation
Critical for: Factory autonomy, adaptive scheduling, fault recovery

content.name: NiFe battery electrode set
content.notes:
Set of nickel-iron (NiFe) battery electrodes - positive (nickel) and negative (iron).
Source: kb/seeds/battery_system_nife_v0.yaml
Positive electrode: Nickel hydroxide Ni(OH)2 + conductive additives + binder on steel substrate
Negative electrode: Iron powder Fe + additives + binder on steel substrate
Construction: Active material pressed into porous steel grids or pockets
Typical composition:
  - Positive: 90% Ni(OH)2, 5% graphite, 5% binder
  - Negative: 95% Fe powder, 5% binder
Capacity: ~0.25 Ah/g for Ni(OH)2, ~0.96 Ah/g for Fe (theoretical)
Advantages: Extremely robust, overcharge/overdischarge tolerant, long cycle life
Applications: Stationary storage, traction batteries, backup power
Lunar context: Both Ni and Fe available from lunar materials or meteorites
Critical for: Energy storage, power buffering, off-sun operation

content.name: Backpropagation circuit hardware v0
content.notes:

Source: docs/paper_reviews/photolithoautotroph_missing_tech.md, paper_reviews_dec2024_comprehensive_v0
Purpose: Analog or hybrid analog/digital circuit for neural network learning

Critical for: Self-optimizing processes, adaptive robot control, quality monitoring
Technology: Vacuum tube or early transistor-based analog computing

content.name: Triode vacuum tube v0

Three-element vacuum tube (cathode, grid, anode) for amplification and switching.
Source: Referenced by various electronic equipment (signal generators, radios, computers)
Elements:
  - Cathode: Emits electrons when heated (oxide-coated or thoriated tungsten)
  - Control grid: Modulates electron flow
  - Anode (plate): Collects electrons
Function: Amplifier or switch controlled by grid voltage
Amplification factor (μ): 5-100 typical
Applications:
  - Audio amplifiers
  - RF amplifiers
  - Oscillators
  - Switching circuits
  - Computing (logic gates in vacuum tube computers)
Advantages: Radiation-hard, high voltage capability, simple manufacturing
Disadvantages: Power hungry, large, limited lifetime (cathode depletion)
Lunar context: Manufactureable from local materials, radiation-tolerant electronics
Lifetime: 1000-10,000 hours typical
Critical for: Electronics in radiation environment, vacuum-compatible circuits

content.name: Electromagnetic relay v0

Electromagnetic relay for switching electrical loads.
Source: docs/paper_reviews/paper_reviews_dec2024_comprehensive_v0
Principle: Electromagnet pulls armature to close/open contacts
Components: Coil, iron core, armature, contacts, spring, housing
Coil voltage: 12V, 24V, or 120V AC/DC typical

Lifetime: 100,000-1,000,000 operations typical
Critical for: Machine control, safety systems, power distribution

content.name: Rover traction control system v0
content.notes:
Traction control system for lunar rover wheel slip management.
Source: docs/paper_reviews/paper_reviews_dec2024_comprehensive_v0, rover autonomy
Purpose: Prevent wheel slip on loose regolith, optimize traction
Components:
  - Wheel speed sensors (encoders on each wheel)
  - Motor current sensors (detect high slip via current spikes)
  - Control computer (implements traction control algorithm)
  - Motor controllers (modulate individual wheel torque)
Algorithm: Detect slip, reduce torque to slipping wheel, redistribute to gripping wheels
Slip detection: Compare wheel speeds, detect deviation from expected speed
Response: Reduce motor torque, apply differential braking if available
Advantages: Prevents getting stuck, improves mobility on slopes, reduces energy waste
Applications: Rovers, construction vehicles, material transport
Lunar context: Critical for regolith terrain (loose, variable traction)
Implementation: Electronic control, no hydraulic systems (vacuum compatible)
Critical for: Rover mobility, mission success, energy efficiency

content.name: Diamond dressing tool

  - Diamond-impregnated tools
Holder: Steel or carbide holder with diamond tip
Applications:
  - Grinding wheel maintenance
  - Wheel form grinding (creating profiles)

Lunar context: Diamond synthesizable from carbon under high pressure/temperature
Critical for: Grinding wheel performance, precision grinding operations

content.name: Thermal circuit breaker v0
content.notes:
Thermal circuit breaker for automatic overcurrent protection.
Source: docs/paper_reviews/paper_reviews_dec2024_comprehensive_v0
Principle: Bimetallic strip heats and bends under overcurrent, trips mechanism
Components: Bimetallic element, latch mechanism, contacts, reset lever
Rating: 5-50A typical at 120-240V AC/DC
Trip time: Inverse time characteristic (faster at higher overcurrent)
Reset: Manual reset after cooling and fault clearing
Advantages: Simple, reliable, no external power needed, reusable
Applications: Motor protection, power distribution, equipment safety
Temperature compensation: Some designs compensate for ambient temperature
Lunar context: Simple electromechanical device, locally manufacturable
Critical for: Electrical safety, fault protection, equipment preservation

content.name: LOX/LH2 cryogenic storage tank set
content.notes:
Cryogenic storage tanks for liquid oxygen (LOX) and liquid hydrogen (LH2).
Source: docs/paper_reviews/papers_gap_seed_v0 (rocket propellant storage)
Tanks: Separate LOX and LH2 tanks with vacuum insulation
LOX tank: ~1000 L capacity, -183°C operating temperature
LH2 tank: ~3000 L capacity, -253°C operating temperature
Insulation: Vacuum-jacketed double-wall construction, MLI (multi-layer insulation)
Materials: Aluminum alloy for compatibility and thermal properties
Pressure: 2-5 bar typical for pressurized feed systems
Boiloff: <1% per day with proper insulation
Applications: Rocket propellant storage, fuel cell feedstock, industrial gas storage
Safety: Pressure relief valves, vent systems, leak detection
Critical for: Rocket launch capability, long-term cryogenic storage

content.name: Watchdog timer system v0
content.notes:
Hardware watchdog timer for system reset and fault detection.
Source: docs/paper_reviews/building-physical-self-replicating_missing_tech.md
Purpose: Automatically resets system if software hangs or faults occur
Implementation: Hardware timer circuit that must be periodically reset by software
If software fails to reset timer, hardware triggers system reboot
Critical for autonomous operation and fault recovery
Can be implemented with simple oscillator + counter circuits

content.name: Battery cell casing
content.notes: Protective casing for battery cell containing electrodes and electrolyte. Cylindrical (18650, 21700) or prismatic metal can construction from steel or aluminum. Includes pressure relief vent, positive/negative terminals with insulation, and sealed construction to contain electrolyte. Provides mechanical protection, electrical insulation, and safety venting. Typical materials: nickel-plated steel for cylindrical cells, aluminum for prismatic cells. Must withstand internal pressure, prevent short circuits, and allow safe gas venting during overcharge/thermal events. Mass varies by cell size.

content.name: Forged steel parts
content.notes: General forged steel components for machine construction. Includes shafts, gears, brackets, and structural parts formed by hot or cold forging for enhanced grain structure and strength compared to castings.

content.name: Touch probe assembly
content.notes: Touch probe for coordinate measuring machine (CMM). Precision contact probe with ruby or ceramic tip. Measures part surfaces by touch detection. Includes probe body, stylus, electrical contacts, and mounting adapter. Achieves ±0.001 mm repeatability.

content.name: Battery cell
content.notes: Individual electrochemical battery cell for energy storage. Types include lithium-ion, lead-acid, nickel-metal hydride, or alkaline chemistries. Typical voltage 1.2-3.7V per cell depending on chemistry. Capacity 1-10 Ah for small cells. Includes anode, cathode, electrolyte, separator, and cell casing. Multiple cells connected in series/parallel form battery packs. Used in portable tools, electronics, electric vehicles, and energy storage systems. Rechargeable or primary (non-rechargeable) depending on chemistry.

content.name: SLAM algorithm implementation v0
content.notes:
Software implementation of SLAM (Simultaneous Localization and Mapping) algorithm.
Source: docs/paper_reviews/paper_reviews_dec2024_comprehensive_v0, rover autonomy technologies
Purpose: Enable robots to build maps while tracking their position in unknown environments
Key components:
  - Sensor fusion (LIDAR, cameras, IMU, wheel odometry)
  - Feature extraction and matching
  - Loop closure detection
  - Pose graph optimization
  - Map representation (occupancy grid or feature map)
Algorithms: EKF-SLAM, FastSLAM, GraphSLAM, ORB-SLAM variants
Computational requirements: Real-time capable on embedded systems
Output: Robot pose (x, y, θ) and environmental map
Applications: Autonomous navigation, exploration, construction mapping
Lunar context: Critical for rover autonomy, site surveying, construction
Sensors required: LIDAR or stereo cameras, IMU, wheel encoders
Update rate: 1-10 Hz typical for navigation
Critical for: Autonomous rovers, construction robots, exploration missions

content.name: Electric motor (small)

AC induction motor or DC brushed motor construction with steel housing, copper windings, and laminated core. Includes mounting flange, shaft coupling, and terminal box. Used in pumps, conveyors, mixers, fans, and small machine tools. Efficiency typically 70-85%. Suitable for continuous duty operation.

content.name: Dipole antenna v0
content.notes:
Half-wave dipole antenna for radio communications.
Source: docs/paper_reviews/paper_reviews_dec2024_comprehensive_v0
Design: Two quarter-wavelength elements fed at center
Length: λ/2 (wavelength/2) at operating frequency
Example: 1m long for 150 MHz, 30cm for 500 MHz
Impedance: ~73 ohms at resonance (matched to 50 or 75 ohm coax)
Radiation pattern: Omnidirectional in plane perpendicular to antenna
Gain: 2.15 dBi (reference dipole)
Polarization: Linear (vertical or horizontal depending on orientation)
Construction: Metal rods or tubes with center feed point and insulator
Applications: Communications, telemetry, remote control, radio links
Frequency bands: VHF, UHF, or lower depending on size
Lunar context: Simple, reliable antenna for rover-to-base communications
Materials: Aluminum or copper for conductivity, ceramic insulator
Critical for: Wireless communications, telemetry, remote operation

content.name: Potted electronic assembly

content.name: Cooling water jacket
content.notes: Water cooling jacket for heat removal from engines, motors, furnaces, or high-power equipment. Fabricated from welded steel or cast metal with internal coolant passages surrounding the heat source. Includes coolant inlet/outlet ports, mounting provisions, and sealed construction to prevent leaks. Provides efficient heat transfer via forced water circulation. Typical operating temperature 50-90°C. Used in internal combustion engines, electric motor cooling, induction heating coils, and high-power electronics. Flow rate typically 5-50 L/min.

content.name: Table top (T-slotted)
content.notes: T-slotted steel table top for fixturing and clamping. Machined slots for universal workholding.

content.name: Chemical bath tank set
content.notes: Set of corrosion-resistant tanks/basins for chemical processing baths.

content.name: Modular machine interface v0
content.notes: Standardized interface module for plugging modular machines together. Placeholder until detailed BOMs/recipes are defined. Seed reference from paper_reviews_dec2024_comprehensive_v0.

content.name: Sealed component
content.notes: Component with installed seals, O-rings, and gaskets. Generic part representing hydraulic cylinders, pumps, valves, or other equipment after seal installation. Ready for final assembly and testing.

content.name: Welding power supply unit
content.notes: Power electronics for welding/brazing.

content.name: Electric motor (large)
content.notes: Large industrial electric motor for heavy machinery and processing equipment. 20-100 kW power range. Three-phase AC induction motor with integrated cooling.

content.name: Demonstrated ferrite core (2017) v0
content.notes: Ferrite core demonstration component cited in 2017 demonstration seed; placeholder mass for modeling context.

content.name: Precision caliper set
content.notes: Set of precision calipers (vernier or digital) for dimensional measurement. Various sizes and jaw types.

content.name: Tank shell (steel)
content.notes: Steel shell for quench tank vessel.

content.name: Fastener kit (large)
content.notes: Large fastener kit for heavy machinery. Includes bolts, nuts, washers in larger sizes (M16-M30).

content.name: Frequency modulation circuit
content.notes: Placeholder FM modulation circuit referenced by seed review. No BOM/recipe defined yet; mass estimate ~0.2 kg. Linked recipe: kb/recipes/recipe_frequency_modulation_circuit_v0.yaml produces this item via electrical_assembly_basic_v0.

content.name: Press cylinder (small)
content.notes: Hydraulic cylinder for small press; includes rod, seals, and ports.

content.name: Battery pack (large)
content.notes: Large battery pack for electric vehicles and mobile equipment. High-capacity energy storage for haulers, loaders, and other electric machinery. Includes battery cells, BMS (battery management system), thermal management, and mounting structure.

content.name: Agitation pump (small)
content.notes: Small centrifugal pump for fluid agitation in quench tanks and process vessels. ~0.5 HP motor.

content.name: Press frame (light/medium)
content.notes: Structural frame for light/medium hydraulic press.

content.name: Anvil or die set
content.notes: Anvil/die set for press/forging; coarse mass estimate.

content.name: Calibration standards
content.notes: Reference artifacts for calibration: precision mass standards, length gauges, known unbalance weights, etc.

content.name: Volumetric receiver with porous absorber v0
content.notes:
Volumetric solar receiver with porous absorber material for air heating.
Source: Identified from paper reviews (solar thermal systems)
Design: Porous ceramic or metal foam absorbs concentrated sunlight
Hot air flows through porous structure, extracting heat
Advantages: Higher efficiency than surface receivers, uniform heating
Materials: Porous ceramics (SiC, alumina) or metal foams
Applications: Process heat, power generation, chemical reactions

content.name: Printer control module
content.notes: Control electronics for 3D printer; imported compute assumed.

content.name: Bare PCB
content.notes: Bare printed circuit board after fabrication, before component assembly. Copper traces etched on FR4 or other substrate. Through-holes drilled and plated. Ready for component population. Various sizes and layer counts.

content.name: Steel workbench (heavy)
content.notes: Heavy-duty steel workbench used as mounting surface for contact material application station. Included in BOM for stability and support.

content.name: Vibration drive module
content.notes: Vibratory drive for shaking table; motor with eccentric weights.

content.name: Nickel-iron battery cell (unformed)
content.notes: Unformed Ni-Fe aqueous cell with electrodes, separator, electrolyte, and metal casing; requires formation cycling before use. Placeholder mass from design/battery-design.md process flow.

content.name: Test bench frame
content.notes: Structural frame and work surface for electrical test bench.

content.name: Electronic components set
content.notes: Assortment of basic electronic components for circuit assembly. Includes resistors, capacitors, diodes, transistors, LEDs, connectors, switches, and voltage regulators. Used for building control circuits, power supplies, sensor interfaces, and communication modules.

content.name: Air tank (small)
content.notes: Receiver tank for small air compressor; includes fittings and safety valve.

content.name: Vise mounting hardware
content.notes: T-slot nuts, bolts, clamps for mounting vises and fixtures to T-slotted table.

content.name: Precision straightedge
content.notes: Precision straightedge for checking flatness and straightness. Precision ground and heat treated for stability.

content.name: Assembled cable harness
content.notes: Assembled cable harness for power and signal distribution. Heavier-duty than wire harness with larger gauge conductors for power transmission. Includes cable routing, connectors, strain relief, and protective sheathing. Used in equipment power distribution and high-current applications.

content.name: Position sensor set
content.notes: Placeholder position sensor assembly for solar-tracking hardware. Conservative mass estimate pending detailed spec.

content.name: Basic test equipment set
content.notes: Bench instrumentation bundle for assembly checkout (multimeter, continuity tester, small power supply, test leads). Used for wiring validation and control panel functional checks.

content.name: Bearing cage (stamped)
content.notes: Stamped bearing cage component.
